after: In the plane , a horizontal shear (or shear parallel to the x axis) is a function that takes a generic point with coordinates to the point ; where is a fixed parameter, called the shear factor.

The effect of this mapping is to displace every point horizontally by an amount proportionally to its coordinate. Any point above the -axis is displaced to the right (increasing ) if , and to the left if . Points below the -axis move in the opposite direction, while points on the axis stay fixed.
